page.title: 15Eighty Years of change. cont
page.content: The people in this village often raised extra money by lace making. Potterspury in fact was famous for its lace making and one local lady made lace for Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother when she was the Queen. Entertainment would be self made in the home and consisted of reading stories to one another and playing musical instruments or singing. The general impressions gained from this interview was that Potterspury was a pleasant tree covered village and had a quieter less crowded atmosphere than that of today. Certainly in the eyes of this person advancement offered no improvement.
